Text.name: textTest
Text.content: Hey There! This is just a test. I don't need to insert new lines, because this text will automatically be word-wrapped by my fancy algorithm! Pretty neat, huh? The only thing I have to be careful of is to leave a blank space at the end of what appears to be a line, so that the necessary whitespace token is found. Also, I probably ought to limit myself as to how much text is written in each entry, or the whole screen could end up covered in it.

Option.name: testOption
Option.content: Wow this one is a really particularly long option isn't it! When you select it with the accept key (default is the a button), it will wrap back around to the first text we displayed!@@ This is option two. It goes on to some un-boxed text that eventually wraps round to the beginning again!@@ This is option three! It's super duper long on purpose. Guess what the purpose is! Guess! Okay, I'll tell you... test purposes! YAY! Wow... This can't really work on the first try, can it? You mean, I don't have to spend the next hour tinkering with it? It's just going to work right off the bat? Weird. But AWESOME! :)@@This is option four! It leads to some more text, which then ends this Dialog!
Option.caption: Here are your options:

Text.name: resText
Text.content: You selected option two, didn't you!?

Text.name: threeText
Text.content: You selected option three, didn't you!? Now I'll have to wrap back to the options again!

Text.name: finalText
Text.content: Well, this is it... after this is done displaying, this dialog will be completed, and we can all move on with our lives. What a relief, eh?
